title: genomic DNA from sample1
extract_protocol_ch1: genomic DNA was extracted using the Allprep mini kit (QIAGEN GmbH, Hilden, Germany) following the manufacturer’s instructions
hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)

hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)

hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)

hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)

hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)

hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)

hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)

hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)

hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)

hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)

hyb_protocol: bisulphite converted DNA was amplified, fragmented and hybridised to Illumina Infinium Human Methylation450k Beadchip using standard Illumina protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were imaged using BeadArray Reader using standard recommended Illumina scanner setting
data_processing: Microarray methylation analysis was performed in R. Quality control, including intensity read outs, filtering as well as beta value calculation was done using the minfi Bioconductor package. Functional normalization onto control probes was then used to normalized the raw intensity values across all the arrays and to remove part of the variance attributable to technical batches. We excluded any CpG containing SNPs or cross-hybridizing probes and CpGs with a detection p-value > 0.01 in at least 50% of the samples, resultng in 249874 data rows out of a possible 485577 (provided in the matrix_normalized.txt)
